info.title: Shutterstock API Reference
info.description: The Shutterstock API provides access to Shutterstock's library of media, as well as information about customers' accounts and the contributors that provide the media.

parameters.description: Show images added on the specified date
parameters.name: added_date

parameters.description: Show images added on or after the specified date
parameters.name: added_date_start

parameters.description: Show images with the specified aspect ratio or higher, using a positive decimal of the width divided by the height, such as 1.7778 for a 16:9 image
parameters.name: aspect_ratio_min

parameters.description: Show images with the specified aspect ratio or lower, using a positive decimal of the width divided by the height, such as 1.7778 for a 16:9 image
parameters.name: aspect_ratio_max

parameters.description: Show images with the specified aspect ratio, using a positive decimal of the width divided by the height, such as 1.7778 for a 16:9 image
parameters.name: aspect_ratio

parameters.description: Show images added before the specified date
parameters.name: added_date_end

parameters.description: Show images with the specified Shutterstock-defined category; specify a category name or ID
parameters.name: category

parameters.description: Specify either a hexadecimal color in the format '4F21EA' or 'grayscale'; the API groups it into one of 15 color categories and returns images that primarily use that color category
parameters.name: color

parameters.description: Show images with the specified contributor names or IDs, allows multiple
parameters.name: contributor

parameters.description: Show images from contributors in one or more specified countries
parameters.name: contributor_country

parameters.description: Fields to display in the response; see the documentation for the fields parameter in the overview section
parameters.name: fields

parameters.description: (Deprecated; use height_from and height_to instead) Show images with the specified height
parameters.name: height

parameters.description: Show images with the specified height or larger, in pixels
parameters.name: height_from

parameters.description: Show images with the specified height or smaller, in pixels
parameters.name: height_to

parameters.description: Show images of the specified type
parameters.name: image_type

parameters.description: Hide results with potentially unsafe keywords
parameters.name: keyword_safe_search

parameters.description: Set query and result language (uses Accept-Language header if not set)
parameters.name: language

parameters.description: Show only images with the specified license
parameters.name: license

parameters.description: Show image results with the specified model IDs
parameters.name: model

parameters.description: Show image results with horizontal or vertical orientation
parameters.name: orientation

parameters.description: Page number
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Number of results per page
parameters.name: per_page

parameters.description: Show images of people with a signed model release
parameters.name: people_model_released

parameters.description: Show images that feature people of the specified age category
parameters.name: people_age

parameters.description: Show images with people of the specified ethnicities
parameters.name: people_ethnicity

parameters.description: Show images with people of the specified gender
parameters.name: people_gender

parameters.description: Show images with the specified number of people
parameters.name: people_number

parameters.description: One or more search terms separated by spaces; you can use NOT to filter out images that match a term
parameters.name: query

parameters.description: Raise or lower search result rankings based on the result's relevance to a specified region; you can provide a country code or an IP address from which the API infers a country
parameters.name: region

parameters.description: Enable or disable safe search
parameters.name: safe

parameters.description: Sort by
parameters.name: sort

parameters.description: Spellcheck the search query and return results on suggested spellings
parameters.name: spellcheck_query

parameters.description: Amount of detail to render in the response
parameters.name: view

parameters.description: (Deprecated; use width_from and width_to instead) Show images with the specified width
parameters.name: width

parameters.description: Show images with the specified width or larger, in pixels
parameters.name: width_from

parameters.description: Show images with the specified width or smaller, in pixels
parameters.name: width_to

data.description: Minimal geometric background. Dynamic shapes composition. Eps10 vector.

x-code-samples.source:
curl -X GET https://api.shutterstock.com/v2/images/search \
-H "Accept: application/json" \
-H "Authorization: Bearer $SHUTTERSTOCK_API_TOKEN" \
-G \
--data-urlencode "query=Vienna" \
--data-urlencode "orientation=horizontal" \
--data-urlencode "sort=popular"

get.description: This endpoint searches for images. If you specify more than one search parameter, the API uses an AND condition. Array parameters can be specified multiple times; in this case, the API uses an AND or an OR condition with those values, depending on the parameter. You can also filter search terms out in the `query` parameter by prefixing the term with NOT. Free API accounts show results only from a limited library of media, not the full Shutterstock media library. Also, the number of search fields they can use in a request is limited.

parameters.description: Search term for which you want keyword suggestions
parameters.name: query

parameters.description: Limit the number of suggestions
parameters.name: limit

get.summary: Get suggestions for a search term
get.description: This endpoint provides autocomplete suggestions for partial search terms.

parameters.description: Image ID
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: Language for the keywords and categories in the response
parameters.name: language

parameters.description: Amount of detail to render in the response
parameters.name: view

value.description: Happy Mid Autumn Festival background with golden glitter Moon and hand drawn Moon Rabbits. Vector illustration

get.description: This endpoint shows information about an image, including a URL to a preview image and the sizes that it is available in.

parameters.description: Language for the keywords and categories in the response
parameters.name: language

get.description: This endpoint lists the categories (Shutterstock-assigned genres) that images can belong to.

parameters.description: Image ID
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: Language for the keywords and categories in the response
parameters.name: language

parameters.description: Page number
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Number of results per page
parameters.name: per_page

parameters.description: Amount of detail to render in the response
parameters.name: view

get.description: This endpoint returns images that are visually similar to an image that you specify.

parameters.description: Subscription ID to use to license the image
parameters.name: subscription_id

parameters.description: Image format
parameters.name: format

parameters.description: Image size
parameters.name: size

parameters.description: Search ID that was provided in the results of an image search
parameters.name: search_id

post.description: This endpoint gets licenses for one or more images. You must specify the image IDs in the body parameter and other details like the format, size, and subscription ID either in the query parameter or with each image ID in the body parameter. Values in the body parameter override values in the query parameters.

requestBody.description: List of images to request licenses for and information about each license transaction; these values override the defaults in the query parameters

parameters.description: Show licenses for the specified image ID
parameters.name: image_id

parameters.description: Show images that are available with the specified license, such as `standard` or `enhanced`; prepending a `-` sign excludes results from that license
parameters.name: license

parameters.description: Page number
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Number of results per page
parameters.name: per_page

parameters.description: Sort order
parameters.name: sort

parameters.description: Filter licenses by username of licensee
parameters.name: username
start_date
parameters.description: Show licenses created on or after the specified date

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Show licenses created before the specified date

get.description: This endpoint lists existing licenses.

parameters.description: License ID
parameters.name: id

x-code-samples.source:
DATA='{
  "size": "huge"
}'

curl -X POST https://api.shutterstock.com/v2/images/licenses/e123/downloads \
-d "$DATA" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-H "Accept: application/json" \
-H "Authorization: Bearer $SHUTTERSTOCK_API_TOKEN"

post.description: This endpoint redownloads images that you have already received a license for.

requestBody.description: Information about the images to redownload

parameters.description: Image IDs
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: Maximum number of results returned in the response
parameters.name: max_items

parameters.description: Restrict results to safe images
parameters.name: safe

get.description: This endpoint returns images that customers put in the same collection as the specified image IDs.

x-code-samples.source:
DATA='{
  "name": "My collection"
}'

curl -X POST https://api.shutterstock.com/v2/images/collections \
-d "$DATA" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-H "Accept: application/json" \
-H "Authorization: Bearer $SHUTTERSTOCK_API_TOKEN"

post.description: This endpoint creates one or more image collections (lightboxes). To add images to the collections, use `POST /v2/images/collections/{id}/items`.

requestBody.description: The names of the new collections

parameters.name: embed

parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Number of results per page
parameters.name: per_page

get.description: This endpoint gets more detailed information about a collection, including its cover image and timestamps for its creation and most recent update. To get the images in collections, use `GET /v2/images/collections/{id}/items`.

parameters.description: Collection ID
parameters.name: id

}'

-d "$DATA" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-H "Accept: application/json" \
-H "Authorization: Bearer $SHUTTERSTOCK_API_TOKEN"

parameters.description: Show images that were added, deleted, or edited; by default, the endpoint returns images that were updated in any of these ways

parameters.description: Show images updated before the specified date

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description: Show images updated in the specified time period, where the time period is an interval (like SQL INTERVAL) such as 1 DAY, 6 HOUR, or 30 MINUTE; the default is 1 HOUR, which shows images that were updated in the hour preceding the request

x-code-samples.source:
curl -X GET https://api.shutterstock.com/v2/images/updated \
-H "Accept: application/json" \
-H "Authorization: Bearer $SHUTTERSTOCK_API_TOKEN" \
-G \
--data-urlencode "interval=30 MINUTE"

get.description: This endpoint lists images that have been updated in the specified time period to update content management systems (CMS) or digital asset management (DAM) systems. In most cases, use the `interval` parameter to show images that were updated recently, but you can also use the `start_date` and `end_date` parameters to specify a range of no more than three days. Do not use the `interval` parameter with either `start_date` or `end_date`.

get.description: This endpoint searches for editorial images. If you specify more than one search parameter, the API uses an AND condition. Array parameters can be specified multiple times; in this case, the API uses an AND or an OR condition with those values, depending on the parameter. You can also filter search terms out in the `query` parameter by prefixing the term with NOT.
This endpoint lists the categories that editorial images can belong to, which are separate from the categories that other types of assets can belong to.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Specify `addition` to return only images that were added or `edit` to return only images that were edited or deleted

parameters.name: date_updated_start
parameters.description: Show images images added, edited, or deleted after the specified date. Acceptable range is 1970-01-01T00:00:01 to 2038-01-19T00:00:00.

parameters.name: date_updated_end
parameters.description: Show images images added, edited, or deleted before the specified date. Acceptable range is 1970-01-01T00:00:01 to 2038-01-19T00:00:00.

parameters.name: date_taken_start
parameters.description: Show images that were taken on or after the specified date; use this parameter if you want recently created images from the collection instead of updated older assets

parameters.name: date_taken_end
parameters.description: Show images that were taken before the specified date

get.description: This endpoint lists editorial images that have been updated in the specified time period to update content management systems (CMS) or digital asset management (DAM) systems. In most cases, use the date_updated_start and date_updated_end parameters to specify a range updates based on when the updates happened. You can also use the date_taken_start and date_taken_end parameters to specify a range of updates based on when the image was taken.

curl -X POST 'https://api.shutterstock.com/v2/cv/images' \
-H "Authorization: Bearer $SHUTTERSTOCK_API_TOKEN" \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-d "{\"base64_image\":\"`base64 myImage.jpg`\"}"

post.description: This endpoint uploads an image for reverse image or video search. Images must be in JPEG or PNG format. To get the search results, pass the upload ID that this endpoint returns to the GET /v2/cv/similar/images or GET /v2/cv/similar/videos endpoints. Contact us for access to this endpoint.

requestBody.description: A Base 64 encoded jpeg or png; images can be no larger than 10mb and can be no larger than 10,000 pixels in width or height

parameters.description: The asset ID or upload ID to find similar images for
parameters.name: asset_id

parameters.description: Show only images with the specified license
parameters.name: license

parameters.description: Enable or disable safe search
parameters.name: safe

parameters.description: Language for the keywords and categories in the response
parameters.name: language

parameters.description: Page number
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Number of results per page
parameters.name: per_page

parameters.description: Amount of detail to render in the response
parameters.name: view

x-code-samples.source:
RESPONSE=$(curl -X POST 'https://api.shutterstock.com/v2/cv/images' \
-H "Authorization: Bearer $SHUTTERSTOCK_API_TOKEN" \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-d "{\"base64_image\":\"`base64 myImage.jpg`\"}")

echo "The next step requires the jq program."

UPLOAD_ID=$(jq -r .upload_id <<< $RESPONSE)

curl -X GET https://api.shutterstock.com/v2/cv/similar/images \
-H "Accept: application/json" \
-H "Authorization: Bearer $SHUTTERSTOCK_API_TOKEN" \
-G \
--data-urlencode "asset_id=$UPLOAD_ID"

x-code-samples.source: curl "https://api.shutterstock.com/v2/oauth/authorize" \ -X GET \ -G \ --data-urlencode "scope=licenses.create licenses.view purchases.view" \ --data-urlencode "state=demo_`date +%s`" \ --data-urlencode "response_type=code" \ --data-urlencode "redirect_uri=http://localhost:3000/callback" \ --data-urlencode "client_id=$CLIENT_ID"

get.description: This endpoint returns a redirect URI (in the 'Location' header) that the customer uses to authorize your application and, together with POST /v2/oauth/access_token, generate an access token that represents that authorization.

x-code-samples.source: curl "https://api.shutterstock.com/v2/oauth/access_token" \ -X POST \ --data-urlencode "client_id=$CLIENT_ID" \ --data-urlencode "client_secret=$CLIENT_SECRET" \ --data-urlencode "grant_type=authorization_code" \ --data-urlencode "code=$CODE"

post.description: This endpoint returns an access token for the specified user and with the specified scopes. The token does not expire until the user changes their password. The body parameters must be encoded as form data.

client_id.description: Client ID (Consumer Key) of your application

client_secret.description: Client Secret (Consumer Secret) of your application

code.description: Response code from the /oauth/authorize flow; required if grant_type=authorization_code

grant_type.description: Grant type: authorization_code generates user tokens, client_credentials generates short-lived client grants

expires.description: Whether or not the token expires, expiring tokens come with a refresh_token to renew the access_token

client_id.description: Client ID (Consumer Key) of your application

client_secret.description: Client Secret (Consumer Secret) of your application

code.description: Response code from the /oauth/authorize flow; required if grant_type=authorization_code

grant_type.description: Grant type: authorization_code generates user tokens, client_credentials generates short-lived client grants

expires.description: Whether or not the token expires, expiring tokens come with a refresh_token to renew the access_token

scopes.licenses.create: Grant the ability to download and license media on behalf of the user.
scopes.purchases.view: Grant read-only access to a user's purchase history.
scopes.licenses.view: Grant read-only access to a user's licenses.
scopes.collections.edit: Grant the ability to create new collections, edit a collection, and modify the contents of a collection
scopes.collections.view: Grant read-only access to a collection and its contents.

AccessTokenDetails.description: Access token details that are currently associated with this user

client_id.description: Client ID that is associated with the user

contributor_id.description: Contributor ID that is associated with the user

customer_id.description: Customer ID that is associated with the user

expires_in.description: Number of seconds until the access token expires; no expiration if this value is null

organization_id.description: Organization ID that is associated with the user

scopes.description: Scopes that this access token provides when used as authentication

user_id.description: User ID that is associated with the user

username.description: User name that is associated with the user

errors.description: Error list; appears only if there was an error

total_count.description: Total count of all results

format.description: Format or extension of the media, such as mpeg for videos or jpeg for images

min_resolution.description: Width of the media, in pixels, allowed by this license

size.description: Keyword that details the size of the media, such as hd or sd for video, huge or vector for images

LicenseImage.description: Data required to license an image

editorial_acknowledgement.description: Set to true to acknowledge the editorial agreement

price.description: For revenue-sharing transactions, the final cost to the end customer

search_id.description: ID of the search that led to this licensing transaction

subscription_id.description: ID of the subscription to use for the download.

LicenseImageResult.description: The response to a licensing request for an image

allotment_charge.description: Number of credits that this licensing event used

download.description: Information that is needed to download the image

error.description: Error message, appears only if there was an error

price.description: Wholesale price information; only for rev-share partners

LicenseImageResultDataList.description: List of information about licensed images

errors.description: Error list; appears only if there was an error

total_count.description: Total count of all results across all pages

LicenseRequestMetadata.description: Additional information for license requests for enterprise accounts and API subscriptions, 4 fields maximum; which fields are required is set by the account holder

LicenseVideo.description: Data required to license a video

editorial_acknowledgement.description: Whether or not this item is editorial content

price.description: Retail price amount; only for rev-share partners

search_id.description: ID of the search that led to this licensing event

size.description: Size of the video being licensed

subscription_id.description: ID of the subscription used for this license

video_id.description: ID of the video being licensed

LicenseVideoResult.description: The response to a licensing request for a video

allotment_charge.description: Number of credits that this licensing event used

error.description: Potential error that occurred during licensing

price.description: Wholesale price information; only for rev-share partners only

video_id.description: ID of the video that was licensed

errors.description: Error list; appears only if there was an error

total_count.description: Total count of all results across all pages

Model.description: Information about a human model or property that appears in media; used to search for assets that this model is in

id.description: ID of the model or property release

OauthAccessTokenResponse.description: Access token response to client apps

access_token.description: Access token that can be used for future requests

expires_in.description: Number of seconds before token expires, only present for expiring tokens

refresh_token.description: A refresh token that can be used to renew the access_token when it expires, only present for expiring tokens

user_token.description: Metadata about the access_token, only present for expiring tokens

local_amount.description: Dollar amount of the calculated rev-share price in the currency local_currency

local_currency.description: Currency of the rev-share price that was calculated

errors.description: Error list; appears only if there was an error

total_count.description: Total count of all results across all pages

RedownloadImage.description: Data required to redownload an image

RedownloadVideo.description: Data required to redownload a video

formats.description: List of formats that are licensable for the subscription

id.description: Unique internal identifier for the subscription

license.description: Internal identifier for the type of subscription

asset_type.description: Identifier for the type of assets associated with this subscription (images, videos, audio, editorial)

errors.description: Error list; appears only if there was an error

page.description: Current page that is being queried

per_page.description: Amount of subscriptions to show per page

total_count.description: Total number of subscriptions for this user

TestEcho.description: Text to echo in the response

header.description: Headers as included in the request

query.description: Query as included in the request

user-agent.description: User agent to expect in the response

id.description: Integer ID that was passed in the request

tag.description: List of tags that were passed in the request

height.description: Height in pixels of the image thumbnail

width.description: Width in pixels of the image thumbnail

UpdatedMedia.description: Information about a piece of updated media

updated_time.description: Date that the media was updated

updates.description: Types of updates that were made to the piece of media

errors.description: Error list; appears only if there was an error

total_count.description: Total count of all results across all pages

url.description: URL that can be used to download the unwatermarked, licensed asset

contributor_id.description: Unique internal identifier of the user, as a contributor

customer_id.description: Unique internal identifier of the user, as a purchaser

full_name.description: Full name including first, middle, and last name of the user

id.description: Unique internal identifier for the user, not tied to contributor or purchasing customer

is_premier.description: True if the user has access to the Premier collection, false otherwise

is_premier_parent.description: True if the user has access to the Premier collection and also has child users

language.description: Main language of the user account

only_enhanced_license.description: True if the user has an enterprise license, false otherwise

only_sensitive_use.description: True if the user has access to sensitive use only, false otherwise

organization_id.description: Unique internal identifier for the user's organization, specific to Premier users

premier_permissions.description: List of permissions allowed through the Premier client

username.description: User name associated to the user

added_date.description: Date this video was added to the Shutterstock library

affiliate_url.description: Affiliate referral link; appears only for registered affiliate partners

aspect.description: Aspect ratio of this video in decimal format

duration.description: Duration of this video, in seconds

has_model_release.description: Whether or not this video has been released for use by the model appearing in it

has_property_release.description: Whether or not this video has received a release to show the landmark or property appearing in it

is_adult.description: Whether or not this video contains adult content

is_editorial.description: Whether or not this video is editorial content

keywords.description: Keywords associated with the content of this video

media_type.description: Media type of this video, should always be "video"

models.description: List of models in this video

url.description: Link to video information page; included only for certain accounts

errors.description: Error list; appears only if there was an error

total_count.description: Total count of all results across all pages
Total count of all results across all pages

display_name.description: Display name of this video size

file_size.description: File size (in bytes) of this video size

fps.description: Frames per second of this video size

is_licensable.description: Whether or not videos can be licensed in this video size
